subject: Re: Missing invoice for 22040
body:
Hi Joseph,
Yes, we haven't spoken for a while but it was during a holidays period so I thought you were enjoying sunny beaches :)
Hot days are over in this part of Europe and nights are pretty chilly (only +2 C today) and unless you are in some sunny spots you can feel cold in the air during the day. We are still waiting for a regular Indian summer but I doubt if it comes this year.
Sorry for not invoicing that Del Monte job. It seems I have to change my way of invoicing your tasks as I am losing track of them (proofs, corrections, etc.). It hasn't been so important in the past but now, with that horrible inflation here, I have to be more attentive. :) :)
Thank you for bringing my attention to that client (job)
and enjoy your weekend, 
Teresa Karolczyk Translator and Editor Poland Tel. 0048 74-665-31-30 Mobile: +48 660419093 Skype: teresakarolczyk
On Thursday, September 22, 2022 at 10:23:08 PM GMT+2, Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com> wrote: 
Hi Teresa,
 
Hope you are doing well. We have not spoken for a while. Last time you were telling me of the very hot weather in Europe. Hopefully, things have cooled done now. We are having an awesome autumnal time. But knowing Chicago weather anything can change.
 
Nevertheless, I have been processing invoices and I noticed that we are missing your invoice for Del Monte CoC job no 22040. Would you mind sending me your invoice for this job please, as I was not able to find it.
 
I have attached the Log.
 
Take good care. Talk soon.
 
Best, Joseph
 
From:
 Teresa Karolczyk <ourbartek@yahoo.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, August 16, 2022 9:05 AM
To:
 Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Adjusted invoice from Teresa
 
Dear Joseph,
 
Sorry and thank you. I am attaching my new invoice.
 
Best,
 
 
 
Teresa Karolczyk Translator and Editor Poland Tel. 0048 74-665-31-30 Mobile: +48 660419093 Skype: teresakarolczyk

subject: Re: Northspeech | Language services
body:

I hope you have a great end of the week.
Let me roll this conversation to the top of your inbox to follow up on my previous email.
Could you please get back to it?
Thank you.
_ _ _ _ 
Yours to count on,
Anders Novak
Global Key Account Manager

Address: 
4-5 Mitchell Street, Edinburgh EH6 7BD, UK
Phone
:
 +44 208 144 2201
On Thu, Sep 22, 2022 at 10:18 AM Anders Novak <
anders@northspeech.com
> wrote:
Hi Joseph,
My name is Anders, and I am the Global Key Account Manager at Northspeech.
Allow me to address this letter as I would enjoy starting fruitful cooperation by assisting you with solutions such as 
Translation, Proofreading, and DTP.
We can fully cover the Scandinavian and European segments, and we have qualified linguists for all Baltic, Asian and Semitic languages. 
As for the CAT tools, we mostly prefer working in Memsource, SDL Trados, and MemoQ, and we 
have also extensive experience with 
AutoCAD and CorelDraw.
Please let me know if there is anything in your pipeline we can assist you with and I will be glad to help.
Always glad to hear from you.
_ _ _ _ 
Yours to count on,
Anders Novak
Global Key Account Manager

body:

Nice to hear from you.
 
Regarding the invoice just do whatever is easiest for you, ok?
 
Best, Joseph

To:

Not much Fall here yet. Temperatures are still in the 80's, but we did get our little bit of first rain early this week.

Do you want me to submit a separate invoice, or include it in the invoice at the end of the month?
 
Thank you,
 
Leo

subject: Re: Marshallese Translation
body:
Since we don't use CAT tools for Marshallese, no, we can't give discounts for repetitions.
We offer a volume discount of 10% for orders over 10K words.
Krisztina Samu
East-West Concepts
PO Box 735
Kapaau, HI 96755, USA
tel: +1 808 938 8410
fax: +1 808 441 8121
krisztina@eastwestconcepts.com

 Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com>

To:
 Krisztina Samu <krisztina@eastwestconcepts.com>
Cc:
 Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Marshallese Translation
 
 
Hi Krisztina,
 
Thanks again so much for your email.
 
Would you be willing to give us a discount for reps and 100% matches?
 
Also, would you be able to give us a discount prices for bulk translation?
 
Thanks very much.
 
Kind regards,
 
Joseph

 Krisztina Samu <krisztina@eastwestconcepts.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, September 22, 2022 1:45 PM
To:
 Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Marshallese Translation
 
Hi Joseph
 
 
 
Would you be available to do a translation job in the coming days?  Sure
 
If so, do you work with a proofreader?  
Yes
Can you provide us with your per-word rate, please? 
Our $0.40/English word represents Translation & Editing.
Do you use cat tools in your work? 
No we don't. CAT tools don't support the Marshallese language.

María

 Wednesday, September 21, 2022 8:50 AM
To:
 Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Diligent: Vontier
 
Will do, thanks. Just finishing Riccardo’s invoice.:)
 
 
From:
 Maria Fagrelius <
m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, September 21, 2022 8:48 AM
To:
 Joseph Parsons <
j.parsons@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Diligent: Vontier
 
We’ll be starting Vontier in the next few days. Sayak is confirming final list of languages with the client first. 
Would you mind checking to see if we have their code of conducts from old jobs (or any other ref materials)? We translated in 2021 for Vontier, some languages under job 21143 and other languages under job 21157. Maybe we have these assets there?  If not there, please also check if we have translated before for Vontier (previous to 2021). Those codes maybe there too. Honestly I don’t remember if Tarra has ever send us reference materials for this client. 
If we don’t have any ref please let me know and I’ll ask Sayak.
Oh! I created a folder to place any reference materials on the job folder. Please place there if we have any.
Thanks!
 
 
Maria Fagrelius

subject: Marshallese Translation
body:
Hi Krisztina,
 
Hope this email finds you well and safe.
My name is Joseph from LCW. Joan from Carasmatic Productions very kindly recommended you as a great translator for Marshallese.
 
Moreover, please e-meet my supervisor, Maria Fagrelius 
m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com
 .
 
Regarding our translation request: 
 
Would you be available to do a translation job in the coming days?
 
If so, do you work with a proofreader?
Can you provide us with your per-word rate, please?
Do you use cat tools in your work?
 
We look very much to working with you, Krisztina.
 
Kind thanks.
 
Best regards, Maria and Joseph

subject: LCW<>Artemis Potential collaboration
body:
Dear
 
Joseph,
 
I hope you’re doing great.
 
My name is 
Laila
 and I’m a business developer for 
Artemis
.
 
I am writing to introduce our company to you and we will have pleasure if we worked with you.
 
Artemis has specialized in many different types of document translation services (Life Science, Legal, Technical, Financial, Games and others. 
 
Work can be done using CAT tools i.e., SDL Trados Studio 2021, Word fast, Idiom World Server, Memo Source, Translation Workspace, Leaf Studio in addition to QA tools of LTB, X-bench, and PQAC).
 
Artemis Accomplishes project’s with only "Native Translators" as a very strict objective for us with the suitable experience in the requested fields.
As a result, we would like to show our interest in the 
English to Marshallese to Lao
 
translation project posted on ProZ, as we have the knowledge and experience necessary to offer support in this specific language pair. We can do so at affordable prices that are certain to be of high quality and adhere to your budget.
We believe that our collaboration will be of great value when you need to be sure that the translation you receive is of exceptional quality and has been proofread by a native speaker.
in regards we offer to make a test translation for free or work on a small project.
We look forward to a successful working relationship with you in the near future.
If you have any query or visit our website on 
www.artemis-tlc.com
 
 
 
Kind Regards,
Laila Adam
Business Developer

11D Abd El Aziz Badr-El Laselky District,  New Maadi-11742, Cairo, Egypt.

body:

The client mentioned after hours, that for now we can provide a quote into Russian and Spanish, so I will work on that quote. Keep me posted if you have any hits on this post.
Note: I'll be unavailable during early morning. I have a dr. app at 8:30. Fyi.
Thanks,


María

subject: FW: QA Review for Hollister 22095
body:
From:
 Charlotte Corty <charlottecorty@gmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, September 14, 2022 5:36 AM
To:
 Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: QA Review for Hollister 22095
 
Hi Joseph,
 
Unfortunately, I was not aware that there was a DA video for the section Accurate Books and Records and I have used different terms, so that the quiz does not match the video well enough.
I send a version with this section revised.
 
Sorry for the inconvenience, but I believe it needs to be changed and I will revise that section after the changes are made.
Other sections are commented through the link.
 
Best,
Charlotte
 
 
 
Den tir. 13. sep. 2022 kl. 20.36 skrev Joseph Parsons <
j.parsons@lcwmail.com
>:
Hi Mar and Charlotte,
 
Hope you are doing well.
 
We have a new QA job for you.

subject: Reserve your seat now: Preparing for Indigenous People's Heritage Month
body:
Join LCW as we engage in conversation and learning activities to highlight the rich diversity of Indigenous Communities in North America.
 
 
Join us for next week's client event: 
Planning for Indigenous People's Heritage Month
 
Reserve your seat!
 
You've been selected by an LCW staff member for an exclusive invite to our upcoming client event!
 
This webinar allows participants to contextualize current events in the broader Indigenous experience and preview an activity from LCW’s hourlong training session "Spotlight on Indigenous People in North America."
Together we will: 
Unpack current events & issues affecting Indigenous communities
Introduce the diversity of Indigenous people in North America
Review worldviews that guide many Indigenous communities
Make sure to reserve your seat now; seats for this session are available on a first-come basis!
 
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2022 Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, All rights reserved.
Our mailing address is:
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe from this list
.

 Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Subject:

Hi Joseph,
 
Mystery solved: 22018, as a translation, had already been included in our April invoice (T220413-01-EIS attached here for your reference only - that invoice has already been paid); the QA must have arrived after we had already invoiced the translation.
 
So I think the new invoice is goo as is: 22008 doesn't need to be added, as we never did the QA, and 22018 was invoiced earlier.
 
Thank you, and best regards,
 
Riccardo

subject: How are you? LCW is curious to hear your opinion!
body:
Based upon your feedback, opinion and ideas we can create a positive working atmosphere together.
May we ask you a few questions?
 
SHARE YOUR OPINION!
 
Weekly Pulse survey every Wednesday for the next 6 months
 
More about the theme mood
 
Emotions drive our actions and thoughts. Your mood during work can determine how you handle stressful situations, how productive you are and how well you perform. Moods can also trigger (positive or negative) behaviors of co-workers! Therefore it is important for your team or organization to receive regular (anonymous) feedback about how you feel at work and why. In this way they can contribute to your job satisfaction and a positive working climate. 
Thanks in advance!
Safe & Confidential
Participation in surveys of 2DAYSMOOD is not mandatory.

subject: Your daily briefing
body:
Hi Joseph Parsons, 
It's a new day! 
 
Commitments and follow-ups 
From your messages 
 
Maria Fagrelius 
 
RE: Outstanding Invoice for ARA and URDU job 22092
 
Yesterday
 
they asked
, "Please make sure you re-call the invoice you sent for payment since Osama will issue a new one." 
 
Ondrej Sendler 
 
RE: Your outstanding invoices for translation services rendered: 21163, 22041,
 
Yesterday
 
you said
, "Yes, I will check." 
 
Charlotte Corty 
 
Re: 2-sentence translation re Hollister 22095
 
Yesterday
 
they asked
, "Oh, sorry there was just one more thing: would you mind sending me a TM, please?" 
 
WoW pn 
 
Re: Final files
 
2 days ago
 
they asked
, "Would you mind providing me with an update regarding the final files for the two-sentence translation that Eckhard proofread, please?" 
 
M RV 
 
Re: Your outstanding invoices for translation services rendered: 21163, 22016, 22018, 22040, 22044, 22047, 22054, 22069, 22073, 22074, 22082.
 
2 days ago
 
they asked

Important Notes
Terms of Sale
This Quote will, if Customer issues a purchase order for the quoted items that is accepted by Supplier, constitute a contract between the entity issuing this Quote (“Supplier”) and the entity to whom this Quote was issued (“Customer”). Unless otherwise stated herein, pricing is valid for thirty days from the date of this Quote. All product, pricing and other information is based on the latest information available and is subject to change. Supplier reserves the right to cancel this Quote and Customer purchase orders arising from pricing errors. Taxes and/or freight charges listed on this Quote are only estimates. The final amounts shall be stated on the relevant invoice. Additional freight charges will be applied if Customer requests expedited shipping. Please indicate any tax exemption status on your purchase order and send your tax exemption certificate to 
Tax_Department@dell.com
 or 
ARSalesTax@emc.com
, as applicable.
Governing Terms
: This Quote is subject to: (a) a separate written agreement between Customer or Customer’s affiliate and Supplier or a Supplier´s affiliate to the extent that it expressly applies to the products and/or services in this Quote or, to the extent there is no such agreement, to the applicable set of Dell’s Terms of Sale (available at 
www.dell.com/terms
 or 
www.dell.com/oemterms
), or for cloud/as-a-Service offerings, the applicable cloud terms of service (identified on the Offer Specific Terms referenced below); and (b) the terms referenced herein (collectively, the “Governing Terms”). Different Governing Terms may apply to different products and services on this Quote. The Governing Terms apply to the exclusion of all terms and conditions incorporated in or referred to in any documentation submitted by Customer to Supplier.
Supplier Software Licenses and Services Descriptions
: Customer’s use of any Supplier software is subject to the license terms accompanying the software, or in the absence of accompanying terms, the applicable terms posted on 
www.Dell.com/eula
. Descriptions and terms for Supplier-branded standard services are stated at 
www.dell.com/servicecontracts/global
 or for certain infrastructure products at 
www.dellemc.com/en-us/customer-services/product-warranty-and-service-descriptions.htm
.
Offer-Specific, Third Party and Program Specific Terms
: Customer’s use of third-party software is subject to the license terms that accompany the software. Certain Supplier-branded and third-party products and services listed on this Quote are subject to additional, specific terms stated on 
www.dell.com/offeringspecificterms
 (“Offer Specific Terms”).
In case of Resale only
: Should Customer procure any products or services for resale, whether on standalone basis or as part of a solution, Customer shall include the applicable software license terms, services terms, and/or offer-specific terms in a written agreement with the end-user and provide written evidence of doing so upon receipt of request from Supplier.
In case of Financing only
: If Customer intends to enter into a financing arrangement (“Financing Agreement”) for the products and/or services on this Quote with Dell Financial Services LLC or other funding source pre-approved by Supplier (“FS”), Customer may issue its purchase order to Supplier or to FS. If issued to FS, Supplier will fulfill and invoice FS upon confirmation that: (a) FS intends to enter into a Financing Agreement with Customer for this order; and (b) FS agrees to procure these items from Supplier. Notwithstanding the Financing Agreement, Customer’s use (and Customer’s resale of and the end-user’s use) of these items in the order is subject to the applicable governing agreement between Customer and Supplier, except that title shall transfer from Supplier to FS instead of to Customer. If FS notifies Supplier after shipment that Customer is no longer pursuing a Financing Agreement for these items, or if Customer fails to enter into such Financing Agreement within 120 days after shipment by Supplier, Customer shall promptly pay the Supplier invoice amounts directly to Supplier.
Customer represents that this transaction does not involve: (a) use of U.S. Government funds; (b) use by or resale to the U.S. Government; or (c) maintenance and support of the product(s) listed in this document within classified spaces. Customer further represents that this transaction does not require Supplier’s compliance with any statute, regulation or information technology standard applicable to a U.S. Government procurement.
For certain products shipped to end users in California, a State Environmental Fee will be applied to Customer’s invoice. Supplier encourages customers to dispose of electronic equipment properly.
Electronically linked terms and descriptions are available in hard copy upon request.

subject: RE: Dell EOY Planning From Zach!!!
body:
Hi Zachary,
 
Thanks for reaching out.
A while ago I ordered a stick of Ram.
I was wondering if you could send me a link to order a stick or two again, please?
 
Thanks.
Kind regards,
Joseph
 
From:
 Woods, Zachary <Zachary.Woods@Dell.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, September 20, 2022 9:51 AM
To:
 Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Dell EOY Planning From Zach!!!
 
Good morning and happy Tuesday!
 
It’s that time again! We are quickly approaching Dell’s Fiscal End of Quarter which comes with several Preferred Customer promotions! 
These will be running through Friday 10/28.
These promotions include deals on 
Laptops & desktops
, 
Monitors
 and other accessories, 
Servers, Networking
, 
Storage
, 
Software 
and much more!
We are also approaching the 
End of Year
. Before you know it, we will be into the Holiday season and preparing for a new year! As we approach this time, we do expect volume increases leading to extend lead times. We highly recommend that if you have any projects in the works to get handled before EOY, you let us know so that we may help you start planning.
 
As always, I’m here to help you tackle your toughest IT challenges, please don’t hesitate to reach out to me directly at 
Zachary.Woods@dell.com
 
or
 
512.513.3946
.
 
Note: If you are making a purchase through Dell.com, go ahead and email me the cart. I will make sure the order is processed correctly and help answer any questions you may have
.
 
Your Dell customer number: 530028173042
 
I look forward to hearing from you!
 
Zachary Woods
Small Business Advisor
Phone number: 512-513-3946
Zachary.Woods@Dell.com
 
 
Internal Use - Confidential

; Joseph Parsons 
<j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Job no 2022362 Diligent own with addendum
 
Hi Wolfram, María and Joseph,
The usual procedure at LCW is that the translator sends the proofreader his files, the proofreader sends them back to the translator after his/her work is done and the translator finalizes the files. This means that the translator has the final say on how the text should finally read, not the proofreader. 
Maybe Wolfram was not aware of this?
If it helps and speeds up the finalization, I could of course, send Word files of the cleaned texts with my suggestions as finals.
Kind regards, Eckhard

subject: End of the Year Suggestions/Recommendations
body:
Hi Culture Team!
 
It’s that time of the year where I normally start searching for:
Client Gift Vendors
Organizations to donate to
Birthday Gift Vendors
Work Anniversary Vendors
Welcome to LCW Vendors
 
The two that have to be decided on by October are the client gift vendor and the two organizations to donate to. 
 
Below are the prerequisites I look for in each. 
 
Client Gift Vendors
BIPOC or woman owned business
Easy multi-address shipping options
Logo and message customization
Gift options $35 and under (due to IRS restrictions)
Preferred but not required Chicago-based company
 
Two Organizations to donate to
Chicago-based organization – non-profit
Last year’s pick: 
Brave Space Alliance
Nationwide organization
Last year’s pick: YWCA
 
If you have any companies or organizations in mind, please send them my way. The events & celebration team will discuss and select them at our meeting next week. 
 
Thanks,
 
Briza Cardenas
(she/her/hers)
Executive Assistant
Email: 
b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Phone: 773-938-3767 (CST)

; Joseph Parsons 
<j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Job no 2022362 Diligent own with addendum
 
Hi Wolfram, María and Joseph,
The usual procedure at LCW is that the translator sends the proofreader his files, the proofreader sends them back to the translator after his/her work is done and the translator finalizes the files. This means that the translator has the final say on how the text should finally read, not the proofreader. 
Maybe Wolfram was not aware of this?
If it helps and speeds up the finalization, I could of course, send Word files of the cleaned texts with my suggestions as finals.
Kind regards, Eckhard

subject: RE: Job no 2022362 Diligent own with addendum
body:
Hi team,
The client would like that title translated. Can someone please send and we’ll introduce into the finals files we created from Eckard’s proofread files. Here is the tittle again:
 
 
María
 
From:
 Eckhard Böhle <eckhard.boehle@netcologne.de> 
Sent:
 Monday, September 19, 2022 9:39 AM
To:
 WoW pn <philnat@wxix.net>; Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>; Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Job no 2022362 Diligent own with addendum
 
Hi Wolfram, María and Joseph,
The usual procedure at LCW is that the translator sends the proofreader his files, the proofreader sends them back to the translator after his/her work is done and the translator finalizes the files. This means that the translator has the final say on how the text should finally read, not the proofreader. 
Maybe Wolfram was not aware of this?
If it helps and speeds up the finalization, I could of course, send Word files of the cleaned texts with my suggestions as finals.
Kind regards, Eckhard
Am 19.09.2022 um 16:28 schrieb WoW pn:
what finals ? i sent the 2 file and the project files 2 days ago - don't have access to them until perhaps later tonight - i am not sure what do you mean 'final'
 
WoW pn /BlackBerry

m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com

Sorry to hear that Eckhard. Wolfram, I know you’re in German time. Would you be able to send us finals this morning? 
Thank you team! And hope you had a wonderful weekend!
 
María

Hi Wolfram, María and Joseph,
The usual procedure at LCW is that the translator sends the proofreader his files, the proofreader sends them back to the translator after his/her work is done and the translator finalizes the files. This means that the translator has the final say on how the text should finally read, not the proofreader.

subject: Re: Job no 2022362 Diligent own with addendum
body:
Hi Wolfram, María and Joseph,
The usual procedure at LCW is that the translator sends the proofreader his files, the proofreader sends them back to the translator after his/her work is done and the translator finalizes the files. This means that the translator has the final say on how the text should finally read, not the proofreader. 
Maybe Wolfram was not aware of this?
If it helps and speeds up the finalization, I could of course, send Word files of the cleaned texts with my suggestions as finals.
Kind regards, Eckhard

subject: The GALA 2023 Call for Proposals is Now Open!
body:
Rethink, Regroup, Renew
New opportunities to grow and thrive. New trends to adopt. New technologies. Now more than ever, it's important to understand and embrace the changes occurring around us. GALA 2023 Dublin will be the place to rethink established assumptions and ways of working, see how the language industry can regroup for the future, and how all of us, as professionals and businesses, can flourish.
We'll have seven tracks to shape our conference content experience and spur important conversations about the new business landscape. Share your insights in a panel discussion or an inspiring 30-minute solo presentation.
Interpretation and multilingual events – Language services for global events
Economics of the language industry – Talking business from a language perspective
Change and evolution of professional profiles – Embracing the future
Ethics in the language industry – Social impact and alternative measures of success
Technology – Pushing tech a step forward
Accessibility – A new challenge
Project, program and vendor management – Key elements for success
Deadline to submit: Friday, 21 October 2022
 
Read the Full Call for Proposals
NEW! The GALA Soapbox
GALA 2023 will also feature a special track designed to let attendees take a stand, express an opinion, and bring lively debate into the mix. 
GALA Soapbox
 
presentations will be short and snappy (5-8 minutes, max.), no slides or props, just you and your ideas. Have a burning topic that is sure to spur a greater discussion? Let's hear it! 
Deadline to submit: Friday, 09 December 2022
 
Learn more about the GALA Soapbox
 
Sponsor & Exhibitor Registration Opening Soon
Sponsoring or exhibiting at GALA 2023 isn’t only about raising brand awareness and visibility, it’s about helping to deliver a great user experience for all delegates and creating positive connections with them along the way. With that said, GALA 2023 
*does* 
offer some top-tier opportunities to put your brand front and center. From the Diamond sponsorship to Notepads, and everything in between, there is a package for every goal and every budget.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
The Globalization and Localization Association (GALA) serves an international community of organizations and individuals that enable communication and business across languages and cultures. GALA’s mission is to help our members succeed and to drive our industry’s development by building professional communities, sharing knowledge, and advancing best practices in the globalization sector. For more information: 
www.gala-global.org
.
Copyright © 2022: Globalization and Localization Association Globalization and Localization Association · GALA is a non-profit 501 (c)(6) organization 
Unsubscribe
.

subject: Scoro Update: Timesheet and Google Calendar Sync Updates
body:
Good news! Your Scoro site lcw.scoro.com has been updated! This month we're tweaking various aspects of time management in ...
 
 
 
Login → 
 
Good news! Your Scoro site 
lcw.scoro.com
 has been updated!
This month we're tweaking various aspects of time management in Scoro. From a more customizable Timesheet view and improved sync options with Google Calendar to a few smaller updates in between, we are tirelessly working on helping you plan, manage and log your time more efficiently with Scoro. 
See what we’ve been up to!
Timesheet
We’ve made several updates to our Timesheet to help you reduce the time you spend on logging your hours. You can now 
group and sort
 the tasks in your timesheet list to find the ones you’re looking for faster and tackle them in the desired order. For example, group them by project and sort them by due dates.
You can also customize which 
task-related data
 you’d like to see in your grid view to make sure you log time against the correct activities. Furthermore, we’ve added the option to 
Show only current week’s tasks
 to help you easily eliminate any tasks that are not relevant for the current week. And you can now also 
search tasks by project name
 to log all project-related hours conveniently in one go. 
Read more
 
Google Calendar
Our Google Calendar integration now 
supports synchronizing recurring events from Google Calendar to Scoro
. When creating a recurring event in Google Calendar, you should first make sure that Scoro supports the defined recurrence pattern AND also assign either an end date to the event or limit the number of its occurrences.
NB!
 If you have previously added a recurring event both into your Google and Scoro calendar manually, you may need to delete the old event from Scoro before modifying its equivalent in Google Calendar in order to avoid duplicates. Read more 
here
. 
Read more
 
Smart inbox
Now you can 
set the default activity type
 for tasks sent and created via Smart inbox. Moreover, you can have them automatically marked as completed. This helps you save time on repetitive manual work if you process a lot of similar tasks via Smart inbox. 
Read more
 
QuickBooks invoice links
You can now 
add QuickBooks invoice links into Scoro PDF or email templates
. This helps you to streamline payment collection as customers who use QuickBooks can conveniently proceed with the payment directly from that link. 
Read more
 
That's not all! 
See our blog post for more details
.
We do our very best to make Scoro better every day, so we really appreciate your feedback. Let us know what you think at 
help@scoro.com
.
Yours truly,
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2022 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

subject: RE: LCW Weekly Work Status Call
body:
Hi Team,
 
Thanks a lot for the deliveries this week. Below is the agenda for the Monday (09/19) status call – 
 
Client
Discussion Gist
EGA
ETA: 27th September - confirmed?
**CEO Message video still needs to come in from client – placeholder to be left
Hollister
LCW to share final ETA
Louisiana Pacific
LLX still working on outstanding video translations and subtitles - estimated delivery is 30th September. All other information has been shared with LCW - should ideally progress on the module translations in the meantime
Organon
English preview to be delivered by LCW on 19th September - make a check
Paratek
LCW to confirm ETAs (last communicated ETA was 21st September - after receipt of client approval of first video)
**first video with the scorm exit issue fixed was supposed to be delivered on 09/16
Quanta
LCW to share rough ETA (post receipt English approval). Client is reviewing English preview as of now and will share feedback - video titles to be removed as discussed with Dustin and as per the sample shown by Dustin on the CoC awareness video
Menarini
LCW to share rough ETA if possible - from the time customer shares Russian storyboards
 
Enjoy your weekend!
 
Thanks!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray
 
 
-----Original Appointment-----

 Sayak Ray 
Sent:
 July 26, 2022 2:31 PM

subject: Hispanic Heritage Month Live Stream: Muralism & Cultural Perseverance
body:
Bring your questions and insights to this LCW live stream session - September 19th, 2022 at 2pm CST. 
 
 
 
Register to attend!
 
Join LCW & Pilsen Art Tours as we discuss muralism as cultural perseverance!
Live Stream Details:
 
Monday, September 19th | 2pm CST
Description:
 
In honor of Hispanic Heritage Month, Brave Conversations with LCW is thrilled to feature local Pilsen murals, brought to life by the rich history of the Latinx diaspora. Chicago's Pilsen neighborhood is home to vibrant murals depicting the cultural rebirth of indigenous Latinx stories following the Mexican Revolution. These murals serve as visual expressions of national identity that also incorporate Pilsen's own unique culture.
Join Culture Moments host Larry Baker (he/him) and Pilsen Public Art Tour's co-founder Luis Tubens (he/him) for an exclusive, virtual tour and celebration of the Latinx experience through art.
Please use the button above to register for this complimentary live stream. We'll see you there!
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2022 Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, All rights reserved.
Our mailing address is:
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe from this list
.

subject: FREE GALA Webinar next Thursday: Anonymization for Compliance: Yes, but Use It for Protection and Knowledge, Too!
body:
SPONSORED webinar
Anonymization for Compliance: Yes, but Use It for Protection and Knowledge, Too!
Anonymization has become a key feature for both public administrations and the enterprise sharing personal data across jurisdictions and for GDPR compliance. 
However, the roles of Data Controllers and Data Officers are still unclear for many, as it is the need for efficient anonymization and pseudonymization. There are many advantages to having clear anonymization policies, beyond the simple compliance with GDPR/HIPPA/CCPA/API or LGPD to avoid fines.
The same techniques can be applied to identify, mine and extract knowledge from Big Data, to obfuscate content, or to ensure key entities and people that need [or need not] be mentioned are actually mentioned [or not]. Pseudonymization has been used to create and monetize data safely and feed AI systems. 
In this session we will learn... 
If our organization is a data officer or data controller. 
How to act accordingly. 
What benefits anonymisation offers (compliance and beyond).
Basic GDPR concepts and how they affect an IT department and data being shared daily from an organization (mails, documents, pptx, etc.).
NLP features within anonymisation that offer key knowledge extraction.
Thursday, 22 September
08:00 PT/11:00 ET/17:00 CET
Free for Members
Free for Non-Members
REGISTER NOW
 
Manuel Herranz
Pangeanic
 
Amando Estela
Pangeanic
 
 
 
Gala 2023 Dublin
Call for Proposals Opens Monday!
It's time to begin considering what you will submit to present at GALA 2023 Dublin! Tracks will cover themes such as technology, accessibility, vendor management, career development, reskilling, and more. Check back on Monday for the full Call details. 
 
 
 
Gala Resources
Call for Content 
We are seeking your expertise on the following topics: 
Pricing models: the price-per-word model is outdated. What new approaches could we adopt?
If you had a magic wand and could have a new business model for the industry, what would it look like?
Upskilling and reskilling: Tell us how you’re honing or your team’s competencies.
How can we fight the hype and the misinformation around AI? What is your organization doing about this problem?
You could write a blog post, an article, present webinar/moderate a panel discussion, or do an interview. Plenty of choices. 
Email us to discuss your ideas
 
 
 
 
The Globalization and Localization Association (GALA) serves an international community of organizations and individuals that enable communication and business across languages and cultures. GALA’s mission is to help our members succeed and to drive our industry’s development by building professional communities, sharing knowledge, and advancing best practices in the globalization sector. For more information: 
www.gala-global.org
. 
Copyright © 2022: Globalization and Localization Association Globalization and Localization Association · GALA is a non-profit 501 (c)(6) organization 
Unsubscribe
.

Open for limited time discounts on eLearnings, microLearnings, and facilitations to help you prepare for performance evaluation season.
 
 
 
Is your team ready for performance evaluation conversations?
For many organizations, this time of year brings performance management discussions and talent planning. This is an excellent opportunity to equip people managers with tools that enable high performance on diverse and multicultural teams.
LCW's proven materials have been carefully selected to support inclusive leadership during and beyond performance evaluation season by debiasing the management process.

From: Maria Fagrelius

, wow-pn 
<philnat@wxix.net>

<j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
 
Subject: RE: FW: Job no 2022362 Diligent own with addendum 
Sorry to jump in! I think Wolfram sent you the project files from Studio (sdlproj). You can open the project and  you will have both files (sdlxiff). He also attached the Word documents from the Studio project for review. You can use this method if the proofreader doesn’t have Trados – you just export the files for review into Word. Then, you can import into Studio again (after proofing) and finalize. 
Either way will work Eckhard. Let me know if you need assistance or you have questions. 
Cheers.
 
María

Sorry to jump in! I think Wolfram sent you the project files from Studio (sdlproj). You can open the project and  you will have both files (sdlxiff). He also attached the Word documents from the Studio project for review. You can use this method if the proofreader doesn’t have Trados – you just export the files for review into Word. Then, you can import into Studio again (after proofing) and finalize. 
Either way will work Eckhard. Let me know if you need assistance or you have questions. 
Cheers.
 
María

Sorry to jump in! I think Wolfram sent you the project files from Studio (sdlproj). You can open the project and  you will have both files (sdlxiff). He also attached the Word documents from the Studio project for review. You can use this method if the proofreader doesn’t have Trados – you just export the files for review into Word. Then, you can import into Studio again (after proofing) and finalize. 
Either way will work Eckhard. Let me know if you need assistance or you have questions. 
Cheers.
 
María

subject: Re: Job no 22095 Hollister XML player and QA review of Hollister CoC
body:
Hi Joseph,
please find the translation attached. 
The QA task is also completed, time spent - 2 hours = €60.-
BR, Uldis
On 13.09.2022 22:49, Joseph Parsons wrote:
Hi Uldis,
 
Sorry for any confusion caused.
 
The work order from us is:
 
First, please translate the 
 
The attached .xml player into Lithuanian. I’ve also attached a log for billing. This is the player for the software we use to create these online modules. It doesn’t come localized by the software company.
 
Second: We would need your Lithuanian linguist to QA online the module he translated recently. Below are the links to the LIT module and also the ENG module as a reference. Please ask your linguist to insert any changes with the comment tool online. Please ask him to be specific since our engineers don’t speak the language. 
We can pay hourly for this QA task.
 
LIT  
https://360.articulate.com/review/content/9d5c90cb-7862-4e35-9847-d54a60893c97/review
ENG 
Code of Conduct - Hollister ENGLISH | Review 360 (articulate.com)
 
Please note the Menu is still English. We’ll insert the LIT Menu when you return this xml file with all the menu items translated. 
 
Can we please have these 2 tasks completed by Thursday or Friday morning (the latest)? 
 
Any questions please let me know and sorry for the confusion. 
You can use Job 22095 for billing. 
Thanks!
 
 
Thanks so much.
Kind regards,
 
Joseph
 
 
From:
 Uldis Liepkalns 
<uldis@tulko.lv>
 
Sent:
 Tuesday, September 13, 2022 2:43 PM
To:
 Joseph Parsons 
<j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: FW: Hollister Job no 2022343
 
On 13.09.2022 21:58, Joseph Parsons wrote:
Hi Uldis,
 
Here’s the LIT link as well.: 
And the link to the module to be QAd: 
 
LIT  
https://360.articulate.com/review/content/9d5c90cb-7862-4e35-9847-d54a60893c97/review
 
Can you please do the QA for Thursday 09/15/22 or latest for Friday 09/16/22, please?
 
Menu is still English, but it will populate with LIT.
Hi Joseph,
you confuse me. I accepted to translate XML file and we'll do it. And OK, I looked at your LT presentation, looks nice, if not to take into account that it seems not finished (the last page freezes showing only half of it).
But what we are supposed to do with it? Also - the Word doc you attached to your previous email seems to be our own translation. And? You say :'Here’s the module attached for you to test the player.'. 
Slap me with a wet newspaper, but I don't see how can we use this Word file to test anything.
Anyway, to test something will be a separate job and we'll need detailed instructions what and how to do and then only if our translator will accept it, we have people with narrow specialization - writing translators, not testers, you know.
 
--

subject: We want to hear from you!
body:
Hello Joseph, Dustin and Maria!
We hope this email finds you well.
Captions and translations are powerful tools that connect your content with new audiences and we are so happy that you are giving us the opportunity to help you on that journey!
We want to hear from you! We are always striving to create the best subtitling experience based on feedback from users like you. 
Do you have 5 minutes to answer three questions? Please go 
here
.
We are excited to work with you!
Jenny Y. Lam-Chowdhury

PCF
 
&

Hi Joseph,
 
When you log into Zenefits, do you see something called “Medical Insurance”? If so, you should be able to click there & follow the instructions.
 
 
Here is some additional info: 
https://help.zenefits.com/Medical_Dental_Vision/Enrolling_in_Coverage/How_do_I_enroll_in_insurance_through_my_company/000_What_are_the_steps_for_enrolling_in_insurance%3F/
 
If you want to see the plan options, you can find them in Zenefits or here:
 
 
OneDigital is the medical insurance broker that Zenefits uses, so if you have any specific questions about policies, they can assist: 
866-802-5117
service@onedigital.com
 
If you still have questions, please let me know. 
 
Thanks!
 
Nicole Barile

subject: How are you? LCW -  is curious to hear your opinion!
body:
Based upon your feedback, opinion and ideas we can create a positive working atmosphere together.
May we ask you a few questions?
 
SHARE YOUR OPINION!
 
Weekly Pulse survey every Wednesday for the next 6 months
 
More about the theme mood
 
Emotions drive our actions and thoughts. Your mood during work can determine how you handle stressful situations, how productive you are and how well you perform. Moods can also trigger (positive or negative) behaviors of co-workers! Therefore it is important for your team or organization to receive regular (anonymous) feedback about how you feel at work and why. In this way they can contribute to your job satisfaction and a positive working climate. 
Thanks in advance!
Safe & Confidential
Participation in surveys of 2DAYSMOOD is not mandatory.
© 2022 2DAYSMOOD. All Rights Reserved.

Subject:
 RE: Benefits
 
Hi Joseph,
 
When you log into Zenefits, do you see something called “Medical Insurance”? If so, you should be able to click there & follow the instructions.
 
 
Here is some additional info: 
https://help.zenefits.com/Medical_Dental_Vision/Enrolling_in_Coverage/How_do_I_enroll_in_insurance_through_my_company/000_What_are_the_steps_for_enrolling_in_insurance%3F/
 
If you want to see the plan options, you can find them in Zenefits or here:
 
 
OneDigital is the medical insurance broker that Zenefits uses, so if you have any specific questions about policies, they can assist: 
866-802-5117
service@onedigital.com
 
If you still have questions, please let me know. 
 
Thanks!
 
Nicole Barile
Director of Operations
, 
LCW

subject: RE: Benefits
body:
Hi Joseph,
 
When you log into Zenefits, do you see something called “Medical Insurance”? If so, you should be able to click there & follow the instructions.
 
 
Here is some additional info: 
https://help.zenefits.com/Medical_Dental_Vision/Enrolling_in_Coverage/How_do_I_enroll_in_insurance_through_my_company/000_What_are_the_steps_for_enrolling_in_insurance%3F/
 
If you want to see the plan options, you can find them in Zenefits or here:
 
 
OneDigital is the medical insurance broker that Zenefits uses, so if you have any specific questions about policies, they can assist: 
866-802-5117
service@onedigital.com
 
If you still have questions, please let me know. 
 
Thanks!
 
Nicole Barile
Director of Operations
, 
LCW

subject: RE: German translation for Diligent
body:
No worries
😊
 
From:
 Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, September 13, 2022 4:23 PM
To:
 Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 German translation for Diligent
 
Can you please add this extra text to the order? You can place into a word document to be translated, and update the log, sorry for the extra work. 
 
The German Supply Chain Act (Lieferkettensorgfaltspflichtengesetz or “LkSG”) goes into effect for companies with 3000 or more employees in 2023, and for organizations as small as 1000 employees in 2024. Diligent Third Party Management–Compliance offers an intuitive, scalable platform that automates compliance processes and keeps pace with the evolving regulatory landscape. Ensure compliance with LkSG across your entire supply chain with the third party onboarding and monitoring tools from Diligent.
 
Diligent just sent this! 
 
María

 Joseph Sapienza <
jsapienza@diligent.com
>

To:

The German Supply Chain Act (Lieferkettensorgfaltspflichtengesetz or “LkSG”) goes into effect for companies with 3000 or more employees in 2023, and for organizations as small as 1000 employees in 2024. Diligent Third Party Management–Compliance offers an intuitive, scalable platform that automates compliance processes and keeps pace with the evolving regulatory landscape. Ensure compliance with LkSG across your entire supply chain with the third party onboarding and monitoring tools from Diligent.

subject: Re: Job no 22095 Hollister XML player and QA review of Hollister CoC
body:
Thanks Joseph,
clear now. 
BR, Uldis
On 13.09.2022 22:49, Joseph Parsons wrote:
Hi Uldis,
 
Sorry for any confusion caused.
 
The work order from us is:
 
First, please translate the 
 
The attached .xml player into Lithuanian. I’ve also attached a log for billing. This is the player for the software we use to create these online modules. It doesn’t come localized by the software company.
 
Second: We would need your Lithuanian linguist to QA online the module he translated recently. Below are the links to the LIT module and also the ENG module as a reference. Please ask your linguist to insert any changes with the comment tool online. Please ask him to be specific since our engineers don’t speak the language. 
We can pay hourly for this QA task.
 
LIT  
https://360.articulate.com/review/content/9d5c90cb-7862-4e35-9847-d54a60893c97/review
ENG 
Code of Conduct - Hollister ENGLISH | Review 360 (articulate.com)
 
Please note the Menu is still English. We’ll insert the LIT Menu when you return this xml file with all the menu items translated. 
 
Can we please have these 2 tasks completed by Thursday or Friday morning (the latest)? 
 
Any questions please let me know and sorry for the confusion. 
You can use Job 22095 for billing. 
Thanks!
 
 
Thanks so much.
Kind regards,
 
Joseph
 
 
From:
 Uldis Liepkalns 
<uldis@tulko.lv>
 
Sent:
 Tuesday, September 13, 2022 2:43 PM
To:
 Joseph Parsons 
<j.parsons@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: FW: Hollister Job no 2022343
 
On 13.09.2022 21:58, Joseph Parsons wrote:
Hi Uldis,
 
Here’s the LIT link as well.: 
And the link to the module to be QAd: 
 
LIT  
https://360.articulate.com/review/content/9d5c90cb-7862-4e35-9847-d54a60893c97/review
 
Can you please do the QA for Thursday 09/15/22 or latest for Friday 09/16/22, please?
 
Menu is still English, but it will populate with LIT.
Hi Joseph,
you confuse me. I accepted to translate XML file and we'll do it. And OK, I looked at your LT presentation, looks nice, if not to take into account that it seems not finished (the last page freezes showing only half of it).
But what we are supposed to do with it? Also - the Word doc you attached to your previous email seems to be our own translation. And? You say :'Here’s the module attached for you to test the player.'. 
Slap me with a wet newspaper, but I don't see how can we use this Word file to test anything.
Anyway, to test something will be a separate job and we'll need detailed instructions what and how to do and then only if our translator will accept it, we have people with narrow specialization - writing translators, not testers, you know.
 
--

Hi Pat,

While we are working on your design template (we will be sharing that to you as agreed on or before 9
th
 September), I wanted to apprise you of a few concerns regarding the languages you have selected.
Bahasa Melayu
 – Unfortunately, this is not a language that we provide as part of our offering – we don’t have translations in the library for the same
Estonian
 and 
Latvian
 – Unfortunately, for the unavailable videos in these languages, the wait times for translations are extremely high at this point in time – it is extremely difficult for us get these completed anytime soon
We can definitely get the above translated for you, but they won’t be ready atleast till Q2 2023 which I think is not conducive to your timelines.
There are a few videos, the translated versions of which are also missing in the library, but we will still get those translated to match your final timelines.
The attached sheet gives you a fair idea of the points mentioned above 
(JeldWen_Language and Video Choice.xlsx)
**colour code – 
Any colour cell with black dot – video translation available in the library for this language
Dark green cell – video translation not available in the library for this language – but we will translate in time to meet your timelines
Red cell – video translation not available in the library for this language – translations will not be available till atleast Q2 2023
 
 
To compensate for this, if you would want to include any other language translation that is already available in the library then those can be used just fine. I have attached another sheet to give you a fair idea of the same. The languages are specifically the ones for which video translations are available for all of your chosen videos. 
(Current CoC Video Status.xlsx)
 
Please let me know your thoughts.
 
Thank you!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Thank you for your email – we have made a note of this and will start analyzing the content.
 
I have questions regarding your organization codes –
The one that you have attached is the latest version for English, correct? And you would still be expecting changes to this? 
That is the latest version, and it is being circulated for final approval. As we get closer to rolling out the course, I will provide the links where the policy and translations will reside, but as it is still being finalized it is not “live” anywhere.
What about the other language codes that you have uploaded in the fileshare – are they confirmed and good to go for us to use in the final version? 
T
hose translations are the “current” but soon to be obsolete code. I provided them so you would have references for the way we translated certain words, but those will soon be retired.
Also, there is another document – red boxed below – Is it just the older version of the English code that you have attached? 
Yes, it is the “current” English code that will be retired in November when the new one I attached is launched. We are in the process of numbering all of our policies for a Policy Manager launch, which is why it has a different name than the translations.
 
 
A few additional points to note – 
As an update, we will be able to deliver a design template to you for your approval by 
9th September
We will start putting the pieces together with whatever you have shared till now and will work on finalizing the English preview once you approve the design template
We have not received the Topic and Language Selection form yet – would request you to please share that at the earliest – apologies if you have already shared and I missed it by any chance 
The topics chosen are in the deck I attached, on slide 8 – Respecting Others, Conflicts of Interest, Accurate Books & Records. (The 
yellow highlighting
 throughout was for my internal team to review for any additional edits.)
The languages are in the attached Word document.
 
It would be great if you could finalize the questions for the customization deck, your org code etc. and send us a final confirmation along with your approval of the design template once we share it. 
Will do – just waiting for my CCO to make any comments to the questions. The code will not change substantially, and I have it out for a translation estimate right now.
 
Thanks, and please let me know in case of any questions.
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Hi Pat,
 
Hope you are doing well!
 
We already met in one of our introductory calls. I am Sayak and will be working with you throughout your Code of Conduct 2022 project with Diligent. It is a pleasure.
 
We have received several visual assets/documents from you and are currently in the process of reviewing them. Thank you for those!
 
In the meantime, would request you to fill in the attached files and share them with us – 
Topic and Language Selection
Code Customization Template
 
I am aware that you have already shared your existing company “Code of Business Conduct and Ethics” document (English version) with us – that will certainly be helpful for Diligent when creating the 2022 Code for you. Additionally, if you would have similar assets in the translated non-English languages you are expecting, please share those as well.
 
Once you share the requested information and additionally from the assets that you have already shared, the next step for us would be to create a Design Template for your approval and this will become the ‘look and feel’ for your Code. Parallelly, I will also work on and share a milestone document with you.
 
To help you decide which Code Module video topics to choose, please login to your Compliance Wave Library and check the left panel for “Code of Conduct”. As a reminder the Storyboard scripts are also an easy way to review.
 
 
 
Once we receive a response from you, I will setup a call to discuss further.
 
If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out.  
 
Thank you again!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Subject:
 LCW Donation for Sarah Nodarse
 
Good Morning LCW,
 
Many of you know, Sarah has been going through a tough personal time recently. Thanks to all of you that have reached out to support her in any way possible. The unity I’ve seen over the past few weeks has been heartwarming to say the least.

Hi Pat,
 
Hope you are well.
 
While we are working on your design template (we will be sharing that to you as agreed on or before 9
th
 September), I wanted to apprise you of a few concerns regarding the languages you have selected.
Bahasa Melayu
 – Unfortunately, this is not a language that we provide as part of our offering – we don’t have translations in the library for the same
Estonian
 and 
Latvian
 – Unfortunately, for the unavailable videos in these languages, the wait times for translations are extremely high at this point in time – it is extremely difficult for us get these completed anytime soon
We can definitely get the above translated for you, but they won’t be ready atleast till Q2 2023 which I think is not conducive to your timelines.
There are a few videos, the translated versions of which are also missing in the library, but we will still get those translated to match your final timelines.
The attached sheet gives you a fair idea of the points mentioned above 
(JeldWen_Language and Video Choice.xlsx)
**colour code – 
Any colour cell with black dot – video translation available in the library for this language
Dark green cell – video translation not available in the library for this language – but we will translate in time to meet your timelines
Red cell – video translation not available in the library for this language – translations will not be available till atleast Q2 2023
 
 
To compensate for this, if you would want to include any other language translation that is already available in the library then those can be used just fine. I have attached another sheet to give you a fair idea of the same. The languages are specifically the ones for which video translations are available for all of your chosen videos. 
(Current CoC Video Status.xlsx)
 
Please let me know your thoughts.
 
Thank you!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Hi Pat,
 
Thank you for your email – we have made a note of this and will start analyzing the content.
 
I have questions regarding your organization codes –
The one that you have attached is the latest version for English, correct? And you would still be expecting changes to this? 
That is the latest version, and it is being circulated for final approval. As we get closer to rolling out the course, I will provide the links where the policy and translations will reside, but as it is still being finalized it is not “live” anywhere.
What about the other language codes that you have uploaded in the fileshare – are they confirmed and good to go for us to use in the final version? 
T
hose translations are the “current” but soon to be obsolete code. I provided them so you would have references for the way we translated certain words, but those will soon be retired.
Also, there is another document – red boxed below – Is it just the older version of the English code that you have attached? 
Yes, it is the “current” English code that will be retired in November when the new one I attached is launched. We are in the process of numbering all of our policies for a Policy Manager launch, which is why it has a different name than the translations.
 
 
A few additional points to note – 
As an update, we will be able to deliver a design template to you for your approval by 
9th September
We will start putting the pieces together with whatever you have shared till now and will work on finalizing the English preview once you approve the design template
We have not received the Topic and Language Selection form yet – would request you to please share that at the earliest – apologies if you have already shared and I missed it by any chance 
The topics chosen are in the deck I attached, on slide 8 – Respecting Others, Conflicts of Interest, Accurate Books & Records. (The 
yellow highlighting
 throughout was for my internal team to review for any additional edits.)
The languages are in the attached Word document.
 
It would be great if you could finalize the questions for the customization deck, your org code etc. and send us a final confirmation along with your approval of the design template once we share it. 
Will do – just waiting for my CCO to make any comments to the questions. The code will not change substantially, and I have it out for a translation estimate right now.
 
Thanks, and please let me know in case of any questions.
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Hi Pat,
 
Hope you are well.
 
While we are working on your design template (we will be sharing that to you as agreed on or before 9
th
 September), I wanted to apprise you of a few concerns regarding the languages you have selected.
Bahasa Melayu
 – Unfortunately, this is not a language that we provide as part of our offering – we don’t have translations in the library for the same
Estonian
 and 
Latvian
 – Unfortunately, for the unavailable videos in these languages, the wait times for translations are extremely high at this point in time – it is extremely difficult for us get these completed anytime soon
We can definitely get the above translated for you, but they won’t be ready atleast till Q2 2023 which I think is not conducive to your timelines.
There are a few videos, the translated versions of which are also missing in the library, but we will still get those translated to match your final timelines.
The attached sheet gives you a fair idea of the points mentioned above 
(JeldWen_Language and Video Choice.xlsx)
**colour code – 
Any colour cell with black dot – video translation available in the library for this language
Dark green cell – video translation not available in the library for this language – but we will translate in time to meet your timelines
Red cell – video translation not available in the library for this language – translations will not be available till atleast Q2 2023
 
 
To compensate for this, if you would want to include any other language translation that is already available in the library then those can be used just fine. I have attached another sheet to give you a fair idea of the same. The languages are specifically the ones for which video translations are available for all of your chosen videos. 
(Current CoC Video Status.xlsx)
 
Please let me know your thoughts.
 
Thank you!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Hi Pat,
 
Thank you for your email – we have made a note of this and will start analyzing the content.
 
I have questions regarding your organization codes –
The one that you have attached is the latest version for English, correct? And you would still be expecting changes to this? 
That is the latest version, and it is being circulated for final approval. As we get closer to rolling out the course, I will provide the links where the policy and translations will reside, but as it is still being finalized it is not “live” anywhere.
What about the other language codes that you have uploaded in the fileshare – are they confirmed and good to go for us to use in the final version? 
T
hose translations are the “current” but soon to be obsolete code. I provided them so you would have references for the way we translated certain words, but those will soon be retired.
Also, there is another document – red boxed below – Is it just the older version of the English code that you have attached? 
Yes, it is the “current” English code that will be retired in November when the new one I attached is launched. We are in the process of numbering all of our policies for a Policy Manager launch, which is why it has a different name than the translations.
 
 
A few additional points to note – 
As an update, we will be able to deliver a design template to you for your approval by 
9th September
We will start putting the pieces together with whatever you have shared till now and will work on finalizing the English preview once you approve the design template
We have not received the Topic and Language Selection form yet – would request you to please share that at the earliest – apologies if you have already shared and I missed it by any chance 
The topics chosen are in the deck I attached, on slide 8 – Respecting Others, Conflicts of Interest, Accurate Books & Records. (The 
yellow highlighting
 throughout was for my internal team to review for any additional edits.)
The languages are in the attached Word document.
 
It would be great if you could finalize the questions for the customization deck, your org code etc. and send us a final confirmation along with your approval of the design template once we share it. 
Will do – just waiting for my CCO to make any comments to the questions. The code will not change substantially, and I have it out for a translation estimate right now.
 
Thanks, and please let me know in case of any questions.
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Hi Pat,
 
Hope you are doing well!
 
We already met in one of our introductory calls. I am Sayak and will be working with you throughout your Code of Conduct 2022 project with Diligent. It is a pleasure.
 
We have received several visual assets/documents from you and are currently in the process of reviewing them. Thank you for those!
 
In the meantime, would request you to fill in the attached files and share them with us – 
Topic and Language Selection
Code Customization Template
 
I am aware that you have already shared your existing company “Code of Business Conduct and Ethics” document (English version) with us – that will certainly be helpful for Diligent when creating the 2022 Code for you. Additionally, if you would have similar assets in the translated non-English languages you are expecting, please share those as well.
 
Once you share the requested information and additionally from the assets that you have already shared, the next step for us would be to create a Design Template for your approval and this will become the ‘look and feel’ for your Code. Parallelly, I will also work on and share a milestone document with you.
 
To help you decide which Code Module video topics to choose, please login to your Compliance Wave Library and check the left panel for “Code of Conduct”. As a reminder the Storyboard scripts are also an easy way to review.
 
 
 
Once we receive a response from you, I will setup a call to discuss further.
 
If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out.  
 
Thank you again!
 
 
Regards,
Sayak Ray

Thanks Jim – I had put them in 10 days ago but in the wrong place. I feel bad for holding you up.
 
We’re launching the updated Code policy on or about November 1. I would like to have the training ready to roll out later that month, and we will set a completion due date of 12/31/22 to wrap up the year. Ideally, we like to launch all languages at the same time, though a delay of a week or two isn’t terrible.

María

subject: Hollister Subfolders
body:
Hi, I saved the Danish translation under this folder: 2.Final. 
BUT honestly, I’m not sure which one is the correct one to save the translations: 2. Final or 3. Translation. Since it looks like both folders have the same files. As mentioned when the client doesn’t review our translations, the project should have two main folders, ENG and Translations – mostly because we don’t keep the intermediate files from the proofreaders to avoid errors. Can you do so in the future? 
When you’re back please move the Danish translation to the correct folder. No sure which one has the translations you sent to Randy for DTP. 
Oh I already sent Danish to Randy for DTP. I noted this in Job Form.
Thanks!

subject: RE: Your outstanding invoices for translation services rendered: Job 22028
body:
Hi Uta,
 
Using your method, the total equals USD 219.47
 
So, we have 1258 add ((43+85)*0.6) add ((102+635+441)*0.3))
 
Next line 1258+(128*0.6)+(1178*0.3)
Next line (1258+76.8+353.4)*0.13
Next line 1688.2*0.13
= USD 219.47
 
Do you agree with the calculation and how I reached the result?
Did I make any mistakes?
 
Kind thanks.
 
Best, Joseph
 
From:
 Dr. Uta Lausberg - Global Business Linguistics <info@globiztics.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, September 8, 2022 2:50 PM
To:
 Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com>; Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 AW: Your outstanding invoices for translation services rendered: Job 22028
 
Dear Joseph,
 
please count the fuzzy matches, repetitions and 100% matches also. This was the formula:
 
=1258 [NEW WORDS]+(43+85)*0,6 [FUZZY MATCHES]+(102+635+441) [95-99% matches, 100% matches, repetitions]*0,3
 
The base rate is USD 0.13.
 
Word count was based on the log you submitted for billing at handoff.
 
I CC to Maria. Maybe she can provide some training about weighted word counts and how we get to those billing amounts.
 
Kind regards,
Uta

EGA

ETA: 3rd October - good to complete?

LCW to share update on progress with translations - LLX yet to deliver translated videos (will come through by 16th Sep hopefully) - LCW should ideally progress on module translations in the meantime

Organon

Quanta

subject: Let's talk about muralism as cultural perseverance
body:
Bring your questions and insights to this LCW live stream session - September 19th, 2022 at 2pm CST. 
 
 
 
Register to attend!
 
Join the conversation with LCW!
Live Stream Details:
 
Monday, September 19th | 2pm CST (Q&A to follow)
Description:
 
In honor of Hispanic Heritage Month, Brave Conversations with LCW is thrilled to feature local Pilsen murals, brought to life by the rich history of the Latinx diaspora. Chicago's Pilsen neighborhood is home to vibrant murals depicting the cultural rebirth of indigenous Latinx stories following the Mexican Revolution. These murals serve as visual expressions of national identity that also incorporate Pilsen's own unique culture.
Join Culture Moments host Larry Baker (he/him) and Pilsen Public Art Tour's co-founder Luis Tubens (he/him) for an exclusive, virtual tour and celebration of the Latinx experience through art.
Please use the button above to register for this complimentary live stream. We'll see you there!
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2022 Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, All rights reserved.
Our mailing address is:
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045

You can

 or

subject: Hollister - FYI.
body:
FYI – I changed the overall word count to match the Hindi LOG per Manmohan’s log + billing, both platforms, Scoro & Job Form. Our Studio Hindi LOG didn’t use the Hindi TM so it was not accurate.  Hope you don’t mind.
Compass – It’s good practice to double check that the dollar final amount in compass match the Job Form Estimate final $ amount. This is a quick way to verify any mistakes entered in Compass. I found a small error in Hollister Entry in Compass: A Fuzzy match word count was entered as New words so Compass amount was higher than the Job Form. I fixed it. No worries.
Job Form: Accurate tracking is important. Job form noted as Randy sent all the links to be QAd for Hollister. That was not the case, only CHS & DUT. I fixed it.
“Final DTP delivered” should be only marked when the DTP person sends you the links (or documents) to be QAd. I think you populate at the same time you populate “Expected Delivery”, these dates usually don’t match. Randy and Dustin might take longer than anticipated to send you those links. Please let me know if you still don’t understand each column within the job forms. I’ll be happy to explain – I know descriptions are not very clear sometimes. If it helps, we could change the names of those fields so it helps you in the future!
Thanks!
 
 
Maria Fagrelius
Director of Translation Services
LCW 
Direct: +1.773.938.4213

subject: FW: 14th annual online event series for International Translation Day
body:
FYI. Free sessions!
 
María
 
From:
 The ProZ.com team <training@proz.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, September 8, 2022 10:43 AM
To:
 Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 14th annual online event series for International Translation Day
 
Open online event for language professionals
View in browser
 
 
Celebrate International Translation Day together with thousands of other professionals this year, with two days of online sessions, panel discussions, and networking opportunities, hosted by ProZ.com.
 
This online conference is free to attend and will take place on the 28th and 29th of September. More than 40 speakers will be discussing a range of topics that affect translators and interpreters in their work and business. You can also sign up for paid pre-conference workshops to be held on the 26th and 27th.
 
 
See the full program, list of speakers, and event features:
 
https://www.proz.com/tv/ITD2022
 
 
Be sure to register for the event to get updates and reminders as the dates approach: click on "Register for this event" at 
https://www.proz.com/tv/ITD2022 
 
 
We hope to see you there!
 
Best regards,
 
The ProZ.com site team

subject: AW: Your outstanding invoices for translation services rendered: Job 22028
body:
Dear Joseph,
 
please count the fuzzy matches, repetitions and 100% matches also. This was the formula:
 
=1258 [NEW WORDS]+(43+85)*0,6 [FUZZY MATCHES]+(102+635+441) [95-99% matches, 100% matches, repetitions]*0,3
 
The base rate is USD 0.13.
 
Word count was based on the log you submitted for billing at handoff.
 
I CC to Maria. Maybe she can provide some training about weighted word counts and how we get to those billing amounts.
 
Kind regards,
Uta

subject: RE: AFL QA Review : 22105 - CW - AFL CBI Human Trafficking
body:
Hi Eckhard, 
Yes, we could do that too. The only thing, and to be honest, we negotiated rates with this client at the beginning of the year to keep the client. I tried not to bother anyone (at least, not much) asking to reduce rates. As you know, I like to be fair with everyone, and I appreciate your professionalism. Uta’s rates for anything over 95% fuzzy match are adequate for this client. That extra discount we had to provide, for everything over 95%, is really hurting us. 
Of course, Uta lives in Guatemala so her rates are a bit lower for that band. Her translation rates for new words and all fuzzy, it’s the same rate as yours so no problem there. 
Thank you so much Eckhard, as you know I appreciate you very much, not only as a translator.
Cheers!
 
María

 Eckhard Böhle <eckhard.boehle@netcologne.de>

By the way, I had already suggested, as Uta usually has a huge work load, that I also could do these translations with Wolfram (or Lucas) proofing or switch whenever necessary.
Kind regards, Eckhard

Dear Joseph, dear Eckhard,
 
I just sent the other message thinking that this was about the QA request from yesterday. 
I am not available for QA right now.
 
Now I see this is a new translation request. Joseph, is there any chance you can extend the deadline for the German translation by one more day? I could translate this on my Tuesday, i.e. Eckhard would have to proofread on Wednesday German time and I would finalize this on Wednesday morning CST.
 
I wonder why the deadlines for all these modules have become shorter. Maria used to give us at least a week and now it has come down to 5 days. Since I am always booked up I need some lead time before I can start these translations.
 
So, please confirm whether a deadline extension until Wednesday next week is feasible for you.
 
Kind regards,
Uta

subject: End of the Year Suggestions/Recommendations
body:
Hi there Culture Team!
 
It’s that time of the year where I normally start searching for:
Client Gift Vendors
Organizations to donate to
Birthday Gift Vendors
Work Anniversary Vendors
Welcome to LCW Vendors
 
The two that have to be decided on by October are the client gift vendor and the two organizations to donate to. 
 
Below are the prerequisites I look for in each. 
 
Client Gift Vendors
BIPOC or woman owned business
Easy multi-address shipping options
Logo and message customization
Gift options $35 and under (due to IRS restrictions)
Preferred but not required Chicago-based company
 
Two Organizations to donate to
Chicago-based organization – non-profit
Last year’s pick: 
Brave Space Alliance
Nationwide organization
Last year’s pick: YWCA
 
If you have any companies or organizations in mind, please send them my way. The events & celebration team will discuss them all at our meeting next week. 
 
Appreciate your help!
 
Briza Cardenas
(she/her/hers)
Executive Assistant
Email: 
b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Phone: 773-938-3767 (CST)
 
   
www
 
|

I will take this into consideration.
 
Best, Joseph
 
From:
 Dr. Uta Lausberg - Global Business Linguistics <info@globiztics.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, September 7, 2022 12:23 PM
To:
 Joseph Parsons <j.parsons@lcwmail.com>; 'Eckhard Böhle' <nc-boehleec3@netcologne.de>
Subject:
 AW: Job no 22078 HAIN Code of Conduct
 
Dear Joseph, dear Eckhard,
 
I just sent the other message thinking that this was about the QA request from yesterday. I am not available for QA right now.
 
Now I see this is a new translation request. Joseph, is there any chance you can extend the deadline for the German translation by one more day? I could translate this on my Tuesday, i.e. Eckhard would have to proofread on Wednesday German time and I would finalize this on Wednesday morning CST.
 
I wonder why the deadlines for all these modules have become shorter. Maria used to give us at least a week and now it has come down to 5 days. Since I am always booked up I need some lead time before I can start these translations.
 
So, please confirm whether a deadline extension until Wednesday next week is feasible for you.
 
Kind regards,
Uta

subject: AW: Job no 22078 HAIN Code of Conduct
body:
Dear Joseph, dear Eckhard,
 
I just sent the other message thinking that this was about the QA request from yesterday. I am not available for QA right now.
 
Now I see this is a new translation request. Joseph, is there any chance you can extend the deadline for the German translation by one more day? I could translate this on my Tuesday, i.e. Eckhard would have to proofread on Wednesday German time and I would finalize this on Wednesday morning CST.
 
I wonder why the deadlines for all these modules have become shorter. Maria used to give us at least a week and now it has come down to 5 days. Since I am always booked up I need some lead time before I can start these translations.
 
So, please confirm whether a deadline extension until Wednesday next week is feasible for you.
 
Kind regards,
Uta
 
 
Dr. Uta Lausberg
Global Business Linguistics

Residenciales Los Alpes, zona 1
